answers.text:
The City of Wilsonville, Oregon has developed two grant programs that provide funding to local notforprofit organizations. Funds from the hotel/motel or transient taxes are available for events and activities that encourage tourism and community interaction.  Funds from the general fund are available for other 'good for the community' projects by not for profit organizations.   The grants are administered through the Community Services Dept. and reviewed by the Parks and Recreation Advisory Board.   
The City Council created these funding streams to manage a growing number of last minute requests for city fund support from local organizations.   The grants allow Council to determine the budget allotment and the guidelines for the applications without the responsibility for deciding awards.
The materials for these grants can be found on the city's website - www.ci.wilsonville.or.us - under 'i want to'/ apply for.
